summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Alison J. Nathan regarding the conditions of Ghislaine Maxwell's detention at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It explains the rationale for frequent flashlight checks of her cell and why she cannot be provided with an eye mask, citing her enhanced security status and safety concerns.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, currently incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) on an enhanced security schedule.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom this government letter is addressed.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who respectfully submits this letter to the court.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Maxwell.
Strauss, as U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team for the government in the case against Maxwell.

events.title: Court Order Regarding Flashlight Checks
events.description: The Court issued an order directing the Government to confer with MDC legal counsel regarding the use of flashlights in security checks at the detention center.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is on an enhanced security schedule at MDC, resulting in flashlight checks of her cell every 15 minutes, more frequently than standard inmates.
The enhanced security is due to the nature of the charges, the high-profile nature of the case, and Maxwell's own expressed safety concerns about being housed in the general population.
MDC considers eye masks contraband and will not provide one to Maxwell, though she is permitted to use non-contraband items to cover her eyes.
Maxwell is housed alone in a cell, a decision based in part on her safety concerns, as an alternative to housing her in the Special Housing Unit (SHU).
